DataItem.DataItemDefinition: This Data Item allows for a more convenient handling of the messages at the receiver side by further defining the type of information.
Identification of the system from which the data is received.
Absolute time stamping expressed as UTC.
DataItem.DataItemNote: The time of day value is reset to zero each day at midnight

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Information concerning the configuration and status of a System.

Bits.BitsName: Operational Release Status of the System

DataItem.DataItemNote: A time source is considered as valid when either externally synchronised or running on a local oscillator within the required accuracy of UTC.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Information concerning the configuration and status of the Tracking processors.
DataItem.DataItemNote: Both Bits of one TP set to zero means, that this TP is not used in the system.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Information concerning the configuration and status of the Remote Sensors (RS)

DataItemFormat.desc: Repetitive Data Item starting with a one-octet Field Repetition Indicator (REP) followed by at least one report comprising a status of one Remote Sensor (RS).

Bits.BitsName: RS Identification 8-bit Identification number of RS

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Information concerning the configuration and status of the Reference Transponder.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable length Data Item comprising a first part of one-octet, followed by one-octet extents as necessary (depending on the number of Reference Transponders).

DataItem.DataItemNote: This goes on as many as Reference Transponders are available. Due to limitation in decoder we limit the number of transpoders to 50.

DataItem.DataItemName: Position of the MLT System Reference Point
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Position of the MLT reference point in WGS-84 Coordinates.

Bits.BitsName: Latitude in WGS-84 in two's complement.
Longitude in WGS-84 in two's complement.

DataItem.DataItemName: Height of the MLT System Reference Point
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Height of the MLT system reference point in two's complement form. The height shall use mean sea level as the zero reference level.
WGS-84 undulation value of the MLT system reference point, in meters. Geoid undulation value is the difference between the ellipsoidal height and the height above mean sea level
